text: “The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only - and that is to support the ultimate career. ”
author: C.S. Lewis

text: “Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.”
author: Henry Thomas Buckle

text: “You only live twice:
author: Ian Fleming,

text: “We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: “This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.”
author: David Nicholls,

text: “Holding people away from you, and denying yourself love, that doesn't make you strong. if anything, it makes you weaker. Because you're doing it out of fear.”
author: Sarah Dessen,

text: “He thinks he'll be remembered as the villain in the story. But I forgot to tell him that the villain is usually the person who locks up the maiden and throws away the key. He was the one who let me out.”
author: Sarah J. Maas,

text: “One must dare to be happy. ”
author: Gertrude Stein

text: “People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.”
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón,

text: “District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.”
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “Even
author: Hafiz

text: “The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.”
author: Rachel Carson

text: “I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.”
author: Alyson Noel,

text: “A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.”
author: Roald Dahl,

text: “Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war”
author: John Green,

text: “We are all different. Don’t judge, understand instead.”
author: Roy T. Bennett,

text: “To survive, you must tell stories.”
author: Umberto Eco,

text: “I feel free and strong. If I were not a reader of books I could not feel this way.”
author: Walter Tevis

text: “In the midst of winter, I found there was, within me, an invincible summer.
author: Albert Camus

text: “Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.”
author: Oscar Wilde

text: “Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.”
author: Victor Hugo,

text: “What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.”
author: Albert Einstein

text: “Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.”
author: Dan Brown,

text: “To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.”
author: T.S. Eliot,

text: “I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.”
author: Dr. Seuss

text: “May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.”
author: Edward Abbey

text: “The power of a glance has been so much abused in love stories, that it has come to be disbelieved in. Few people dare now to say that two beings have fallen in love because they have looked at each other. Yet it is in this way that love begins, and in this way only.”
author: Victor Hugo,

text: “I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.”
author: Groucho Marx

text: “We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.”
author: Rick Riordan,

text: “I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey.”
author: H.L. Mencken

text: “Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future.”
author: David Mitchell,

text: “My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the heck she is.”
author: Ellen DeGeneres

text: “Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through.”
author: Ira Glass

text: “It is easy to forget how full the world is of people, full to bursting, and each of them imaginable and consistently misimagined.”
author: John Green,

text: “We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence.
author: Philip Pullman

text: “Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.”
author: Thomas Pynchon

text: “I restore myself when I'm alone.”
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: “To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.”
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: “I live for coincidences. They briefly give to me the illusion or the hope that there's a pattern to my life, and if there's a pattern, then maybe I'm moving toward some kind of destiny where it's all explained.”
author: Jonathan Ames,

text: “I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.”
author: Stephenie Meyer,

text: “Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.”
author: Zora Neale Hurston

text: “Do you think that I count the days? There is only one day left, always starting over: it is given to us at dawn and taken away from us at dusk.”
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: “The mind I love must have wild places.”
author: Katherine Mansfield

text: “We are always the same age inside. ”
author: Gertrude Stein

text: “Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.”
author: Steve Jobs

text: “He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.
author: Markus Zusak,

text: “I'm going to keep going until I succeed — or die. Don't think I don't know how this might end. I've known it for years.”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.”
author: R.J. Palacio,

text: “Hang on, did you just call me Angel?" I asked.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

text: “Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.”
author: Helen Keller,

text: “Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.”
author: Judy Garland

text: “I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.”
author: John Green,

text: “To love another person is to see the face of God.”
author: Victor Hugo,

text: “When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.”
author: John Green,

text: “You’ll get over it…” It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it” is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?”
author: Jeanette Winterson,

text: “Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.”
author: Markus Zusak,

text: “Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures.
author: Tahereh Mafi,

text: “You're a guardian angel now." I was still too much in awe to wrap my mind around it, but at the same time I felt amazement, curiosity...happiness.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

text: “What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.”
author: C. S. Lewis

text: “I just want to be wonderful.”
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: “There are much worse games to play.”
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.”
author: Anais Nin

text: “You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.”
author: Jack London

text: “I find out a lot about myself by sleeping. Dreams, they are who I am when I’m too tired to be me.”
author: Jarod Kintz,

text: “Ignorance killed the cat; curiosity was framed!”
author: C. J. Cherryh

text: “Can you be a girl for a few seconds?"
author: Veronica Roth,

text: “Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.”
author: Rainer Maria Rilke,

text: “I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.”
author: Louisa May Alcott,

text: “Moths," repeats Will. "You're afraid of moths?"
author: Veronica Roth,

text: “Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.”
author: Paulo Coelho,

text: “I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.”
author: Stephen Chbosky,

text: “The earth laughs in flowers.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: “To-morrow, and to-morrow, and to-morrow,
author: William Shakespeare,

text: “Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.”
author: Marvin Bell

text: “We are each our own devil, and we make this world our hell.”
author: Oscar Wilde

text: “We are surrounded by story.”
author: Alice McDermott

text: “Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.”
author: Mother Teresa

text: “Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.”
author: Toni Morrison,

text: “I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?”
author: Haruki Murakami,

text: “We need to talk. All of us About what we're going to do now."
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “Is it fair to have given us the memory of what was and the desire of what could be when we must suffer what is?”
author: Neil Jordan,

text: “When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. ”
author: Mae West

text: “If Peeta and I were both to die, or they thought we were....My fingers fumble with the pouch on my belt, freeing it. Peeta sees it and his hand clamps on my wrist. "No, I won't let you." "Trust me," I whisper. He holds my gaze for a long moment then lets go. I loosen the top of the pouch and pour a few spoonfuls of berries into his palm. Then I fill my own. "On the count of three?" Peeta leans down and kisses me once, very gently. "The count of three," he says. We stand, our backs pressed together, our empty hands locked tight. "Hold them out. I want everyone to see," he says. I spread out my fingers, and the dark berries glisten in the sun. I give Peeta's hand one last squeeze as a signal, as a good-bye, and we begin counting. "One." Maybe I'm wrong. "Two." Maybe they don't care if we both die. "Three!" It's too late to change my mind. I lift my hand to my mouth taking one last look at the world. The berries have just passed my lips when the trumpets begin to blare. The frantic voice of Claudius Templesmith shouts above them. "Stop! Stop! Ladies and gentlemen, I am pleased to present the victors of the 74th Hunger Games, Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! I give you - the tributes of District 12!”
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.”
author: Steve Maraboli,

text: “Being a nerd, which is to say going too far and caring too much about a subject, is the best way to make friends I know.”
author: Sarah Vowell,

text: “One day you will ask me which is more important? My life or yours? I will say mine and you will walk away not knowing that you are my life.”
author: Khalil Gibran

text: “Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.”
author: Oscar Wilde,

text: “The question is not what you look at, but what you see.”
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: “Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.”
author: Roberto Bolaño,

text: “Humor is reason gone mad.”
author: Groucho Marx

text: “Heard melodies are sweet, but those unheard, are sweeter”
author: John Keats,

text: “Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.”
author: Margaret Atwood,

text: “I figured all your classes were stuff like Slaughter 101 and Beheading for Beginners."
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “Never miss a good chance to shut up.”
author: Will Rogers

text: “Atticus said to Jem one day, "I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. "Your father’s right," she said. "Mockingbirds don’t do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corn cribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.”
author: Harper Lee,

text: “Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.”
author: Douglas Adams,

text: “I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself”
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: “We'd get sick on too many cookies, but ever so much sicker on no cookies at all.”
author: Sinclair Lewis

text: “Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.”
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: “I don't suffer from my insanity -- I enjoy every minute of it.”
author: Sherrilyn Kenyon,

text: “Watch out for intellect,
author: Anne Sexton,

text: “Always be a poet, even in prose.”
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: “No good deed goes unpunished.”
author: Oscar Wilde

text: “The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.”
author: Marcus Aurelius,

text: “Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.”
author: Betty Smith,

text: “It crosses my mind that Cinna's calm and normal demeanor masks a complete madman.”
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.”
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: “I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.”
author: Franz Kafka

text: “There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.”
author: Judith McNaught,

text: “Blessed are the hearts that can bend; they shall never be broken.”
author: Albert Camus

text: “Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.”
author: Dean Koontz,

text: “Well-read people are less likely to be evil.”
author: Lemony Snicket,

text: “A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. ”
author: William S. Burroughs

text: “A small but noteworthy note. I've seen so many young men over the years who think they're running at other young men. They are not. They are running at me.”
author: Markus Zusak,

text: “A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?"
author: Chuck Palahniuk,

text: “It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere.”
author: Lois Lowry

text: “A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.”
author: Charles Darwin,

text: “No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.”
author: C.S. Lewis,

text: “Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.”
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: “Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.”
author: George R.R. Martin,

text: “Hello, Harry" said George, beaming at him. "We thought we heard your dulcet tones."
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “Life is a beautiful magnificent thing, even to a jellyfish.”
author: Charles Chaplin

text: “A short story is a different thing altogether – a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.”
author: Stephen King,

text: “Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path.
author: Paulo Coelho,

text: “What are you going to do? Everything, is my guess. It will be a little messy, but embrace the mess. It will be complicated, but rejoice in the complications.”
author: Nora Ephron

text: “Never attempt to teach a pig to sing; it wastes your time and annoys the pig.”
author: Robert Heinlein,

text: “However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?”
author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

text: “To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced
author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

text: “She was the heir of ash and fire, and she would bow to no one.”
author: Sarah J. Maas,

text: “Alone. Yes, that's the key word, the most awful word in the English tongue. Murder doesn't hold a candle to it and hell is only a poor synonym.”
author: Stephen King

text: “الحداد ليس في ما نرتديه بل في ما نراه . إنّه يكمن في نظرتنا
author: أحلام مستغانمي,

text: “If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?”
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

text: “After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.”
author: Oscar Wilde,

text: “Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.”
author: Oscar Wilde

text: “But-" Maia, still looking at Alec and Magnus, broke off and rasied her eyebrows. Simon turned to see what she was looking at - and stared.
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “I believe in God, but not as one thing, not as an old man in the sky. I believe that what people call God is something in all of us. I believe that what Jesus and Mohammed and Buddha and all the rest said was right. It's just that the translations have gone wrong.”
author: John Lennon

text: “Jace?"
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “لا تجالس أنصاف العشاق، ولا تصادق أنصاف الأصدقاء، لا تقرأ لأنصاف الموهوبين،لا تعش نصف حياة، ولا تمت نصف موت،لا تختر نصف حل، ولا تقف في منتصف الحقيقة، لا تحلم نصف حلم، ولا تتعلق بنصف أمل، إذا صمتّ.. فاصمت حتى النهاية، وإذا تكلمت.. فتكلّم حتى النهاية، لا تصمت كي تتكلم، ولا تتكلم كي تصمت.
author: جبران خليل جبران

text: “He felt that his whole life was some kind of dream and he sometimes wondered whose it was and whether they were enjoying it.”
author: Douglas Adams,

text: “The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.”
author: Ben Okri

text: “Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.”
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

text: “The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.”
author: Plato

text: “A trap is only a trap if you don't know about it. If you know about it, it's a challenge.”
author: China Miéville,

text: “Clary felt suddenly annoyed. "When the self-congratulatory part of the evening is over, maybe we could get back to saving my best friend from being exsanguinated to death?"
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.”
author: Douglas Coupland,

text: “Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.”
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: “If the moon smiled, she would resemble you.
author: Sylvia Plath,

text: “Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters”
author: Albert Einstein

text: “The best way out is always through.”
author: Robert Frost

text: “...you can hate a place with all your heart and soul and still be homesick for it.”
author: Joseph Mitchell

text: “My only love sprung from my only hate!
author: William Shakespeare

text: “But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.”
author: Stephen R. Covey,

text: “Sebastian just smiled. “I could hear your heart beating,” he said softly. “When you were watching me with Valentine. Did it bother you?”
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.”
author: Neil Gaiman,

text: “The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?”
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

text: “People do not change, they are merely revealed.”
author: Anne Enright,

text: “When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.”
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: “It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.”
author: Charles Dickens,

text: “Our finger prints don't fade from the lives we touch.”
author: judy blume

text: “This is how it works. I love the people in my life, and I do for my friends whatever they need me to do for them, again and again, as many times as is necessary. For example, in your case you always forgot who you are and how much you're loved. So what I do for you as your friend is remind you who you are and tell you how much I love you. And this isn't any kind of burden for me, because I love who you are very much. Every time I remind you, I get to remember with you, which is my pleasure.”
author: James Lecesne

text: “Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!”
author: Maya Angelou

text: “God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!
author: Rick Riordan,

text: “The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of the mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.”
author: J.D. Salinger,

text: “The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.”
author: Mother Teresa

text: “If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?”
author: Maya Angelou

text: “If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.”
author: Emily Dickinson

text: “The good thing about science is that it's true whether or not you believe in it.”
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

text: “I don't hate you.. I just don't like that you exist”
author: Gena Showalter,

text: “Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.”
author: Aristotle

text: “People, generally, suck.”
author: Christopher Moore,

text: “The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.”
author: George Orwell

text: “Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. ”
author: Pablo Picasso,

text: “I like people too much or not at all. I've got to go down deep, to fall into people, to really know them.”
author: Sylvia Plath,

text: “Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element.”
author: Audrey Niffenegger,

text: “Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.”
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: “Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.”
author: Woody Allen

text: “If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.”
author: Lemony Snicket

text: “I clench his hands to the point of pain. "Stay with me."
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “I hate men who are afraid of women's strength.”
author: Anaïs Nin,

text: “Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.”
author: Alan Moore,

text: “What else? She is so beautiful. You don’t get tired of looking at her. You never worry if she is smarter than you: You know she is. She is funny without ever being mean. I love her. I am so lucky to love her, Van Houten. You don’t get to choose if you get hurt in this world, old man, but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices. I hope she likes hers.”
author: John Green,

text: “Remember this: Nothing is written in the stars. Not these stars, nor any others. No one controls your destiny.”
author: Gregory Maguire,

text: “Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.”
author: e.e. cummings

text: “In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard.”
author: John Grisham

text: “Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.”
author: Walt Whitman

text: “There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get out
author: Charles Bukowski

text: “You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “I have accepted fear as part of life – specifically the fear of change... I have gone ahead despite the pounding in the heart that says: turn back....”
author: Erica Jong

text: “She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

text: “I've begun to realize that you can listen to silence and learn from it. It has a quality and a dimension all its own.”
author: Chaim Potok,

text: “All thinking men are atheists.”
author: Ernest Hemingway,

text: “I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky,

text: “I address you all tonight for who you truly are: wizards, mermaids, travelers, adventurers, and magicians. You are the true dreamers.”
author: Brian Selznick,

text: “I will take the sun in my mouth
author: E.E. Cummings,

text: “لا تجزع من جرحك، وإلا فكيف للنور أن يتسلل إلى باطنك؟”
author: جلال الدين الرومي

text: “When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.”
author: Oscar Wilde,

text: “The grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.”
author: George Washington Burnap,

text: “You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.”
author: Neil Gaiman,

text: “If I should have a daughter…“Instead of “Mom”, she’s gonna call me “Point B.” Because that way, she knows that no matter what happens, at least she can always find her way to me. And I’m going to paint the solar system on the back of her hands so that she has to learn the entire universe before she can say “Oh, I know that like the back of my hand.”
author: Sarah Kay

text: “People think it must be fun to be a super genius, but they don't realize how hard it is to put up with all the idiots in the world.”
author: Bill Watterson,

text: “Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.”
author: Cheris Kramarae

text: “I think you should be a child for as long as you can. I have been successful for 74 years being able to do that.”
author: Bob Newhart

text: “مش مهم انك تغير الكون... المهم انك تخلي الكون ما يغيركش”
author: عمر طاهر

text: “You forget what you want to remember, and you remember what you want to forget.”
author: Cormac McCarthy,

text: “That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.”
author: J.D. Salinger,

text: “My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.”
author: Dalai Lama XIV

text: “I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?”
author: Ned Vizzini,

text: “Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.”
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

text: “I pray because I can't help myself. I pray because I'm helpless. I pray because the need flows out of me all the time- waking and sleeping. It doesn't change God- it changes me.”
author: William Nicholson,

text: “Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.”
author: Aldous Huxley

text: “Don't let the muggles get you down.”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.”
author: Bruce Lee

text: “Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.”
author: Roy T. Bennett,

text: “There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: “Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.”
author: Ken Kesey,

text: “But Dumbledore says he doesn't care what they do as long as they don't take him off the Chocolate Frog cards.”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “You always have a choice. It's just that some people make the wrong one.”
author: Nicholas Sparks,

text: “If we listened to our intellect we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go in business because we'd be cynical: "It's gonna go wrong." Or "She's going to hurt me." Or,"I've had a couple of bad love affairs, so therefore . . ." Well, that's nonsense. You're going to miss life. You've got to jump off the cliff all the time and build your wings on the way down.”
author: Ray Bradbury

text: “Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.”
author: Maxim Gorky,

text: “Silence is so freaking loud”
author: Sarah Dessen,

text: “Do no harm and leave the world a better place than you found it.”
author: Patricia Cornwell

text: “The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.”
author: George R.R. Martin,

text: “You will hear thunder and remember me,
author: Anna Akhmatova

text: “For me, literacy means freedom. For the individual and for society.”
author: LeVar Burton

text: “The mountains are calling and I must go.”
author: John Muir

text: “My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.”
author: Sarah J. Maas,

text: “All my days I have longed equally to travel the right road and to take my own errant path.”
author: Sigrid Undset,

text: “The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.”
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: “I figured something out. The future is unpredictable.”
author: John Green,

text: “In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt. And together we will try to hold back the floods to tears and despair and make it through the potholed street of life”
author: Nicholas Sparks,

text: “In the summer
author: Nizar Qabbani

text: “Accio Brain!”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy”
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

text: “It's the mortal cup Jace, not the mortal toilet bowl.”
author: Cassandra Clare

text: “Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand”
author: Hayley Williams

text: “The bird, the pin, the song, the berries, the watch, the cracker, the dress that burst into flames. I am the mockingjay. The one that survived despite the Capitol's plans. The symbol of the rebellion.”
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “Push yourself. Don't Settle. Just live well. Just LIVE.”
author: Jojo Moyes,

text: “There's nothing worse than waiting and not knowing what'll happen to you. Your own imagination can be crueler than any captor.”
author: Richelle Mead,

text: “The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. ”
author: Walt Disney

text: “The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.”
author: C. JoyBell C.

text: “There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'
author: Dalai Lama XIV

text: “Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.”
author: Ayn Rand,

text: “I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity.”
author: C. S. Lewis

text: “I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.”
author: Virginia Woolf

text: “We need not to be let alone. We need to be really bothered once in a while. How long is it since you were really bothered? About something important, about something real?”
author: Ray Bradbury,

text: “Learning to ignore things is one of the great paths to inner peace.”
author: Robert J. Sawyer,

text: “It is not the length of life, but the depth.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: “Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.”
author: Anais Nin

text: “When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.”
author: Albert Camus,

text: “The problem with doing nothing is not knowing when you are finished.”
author: Nelson De Mille

text: “It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.”
author: Jane Austen,

text: “You know it's never fifty-fifty in a marriage. It's always seventy-thirty, or sixty-forty. Someone falls in love first. Someone puts someone else up on a pedestal. Someone works very hard to keep things rolling smoothly; someone else sails along for the ride.”
author: Jodi Picoult,

text: “It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased.”
author: C.S. Lewis,

text: “Spring is the time of plans and projects.”
author: Leo Tolstoy,

text: “If the person you are talking to doesn't appear to be listening, be patient. It may simply be that he has a small piece of fluff in his ear.”
author: A.A. Milne,

text: “Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it.
author: John Anster,

text: “The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.”
author: Mark Twain

text: “When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.”
author: George R.R. Martin,

text: “Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them. ”
author: John Updike

text: “One must live as if it would be forever, and as if one might die each moment. Always both at once.”
author: Mary Renault,

text: “Did you really want to die?"
author: Tiffanie DeBartolo,

text: “While I sleep, I dream of you, and when I wake, I long to hold you in my arms. If anything, our time apart has only made me more certain that I want to spend my nights by your side, and my days with your heart.”
author: Nicholas Sparks,

text: “So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?”
author: Hunter S. Thompson

text: “The worst thing about new books is that they keep us from reading the old ones.”
author: Joseph Joubert

text: “Words were different when they lived inside of you.”
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,

text: “It's so strange how life works: You want something and you wait and wait and feel like it's taking forever to come. Then it happens and it's over and all you want to do is curl back up in that moment before things changed.”
author: Lauren Oliver,

text: “I don't care," Clary said. "He'd do it for me. Tell me he wouldn't. If I were missing-"
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.”
author: Toni Morrison

text: “The advantage of a bad memory is that one enjoys several times the same good things for the first time.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: “The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.”
author: Maya Angelou

text: “if you love two people at the same time, choose the second. Because if you really loved the first one, you wouldn't have fallen for the second.”
author: Johnny Depp

text: “One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others.”
author: Lewis Carroll

text: “Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation."
author: Charlotte Brontë ,

text: “I am not interested in being original. I am interested in being true.”
author: Agostinho da Silva

text: “Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.”
author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi

text: “See, the problem is that God gives men a brain and a penis, and only enough blood to run one at a time.”
author: Robin Williams

text: “He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.”
author: Gabriel García Márquez,

text: “Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.”
author: Terry Pratchett,

text: “I don't think there is any truth. There are only points of view. ”
author: Allen Ginsberg

text: “It is often in the darkest
author: Richard Evans

text: “Every life has death and every light has shadow. Be content to stand in the light and let the shadow fall where it will.”
author: Mary Stewart,

text: “The course of true love never did run smooth.”
author: William Shakespeare,

text: “In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald,

text: “I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.”
author: Herman Melville,

text: “The difference between sex and love is that sex relieves tension and love causes it.”
author: Woody Allen

text: “Whenever my environment had failed to support or nourish me, I had clutched at books...”
author: Richard Wright,

text: “Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.”
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: “To hurt is as human as to breathe.”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.”
author: Nora Roberts

text: “Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create.”
author: Maria Montessori

text: “Question everything. Your love, your religion, your passion. If you don't have questions, you'll never find answers.”
author: Colleen Hoover,

text: “Black hair and blue eyes are my favorite combination.”
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “Dress shabbily and they remember the dress; dress impeccably and they remember the woman.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness.”
author: André Breton,

text: “He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.”
author: Confucius

text: “If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace.”
author: John Lennon

text: “You know, some people think Shadowhunters are just myths. Like mummies and genies." Kyle grinned at Jace. "Can you grant wishes?"
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “I have spread my dreams under your feet.
author: W.B. Yeats

text: “Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.”
author: George R.R. Martin,

text: “The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.”
author: Napoleon Hill,

text: “Be awesome! Be a book nut!”
author: Dr. Seuss

text: “Ghosts don't haunt us. That's not how it works. They're present among us because we won't let go of them.”
author: Sue Grafton,

text: “Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not; remember that what you now have was once among the things you only hoped for.”
author: Epicurus

text: “Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.”
author: OMAR KHAYYAM,

text: “The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.”
author: Anais Nin

text: “That was enterprising," Will sounded nearly impressed.
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “Coach: "All right, Patch. let's say you're at a party. the room is full of girls of all shapes and sizes. You see blondes, brunettes, redheads, a few girl with black hair. Some are talkive, while other appear shy. You've one girl who fits your profile - attractive, intelligent and vulnerable. Dow do you let her know you're interested?"
author: Becca Fitzpatrick,

text: “If you love something set it free, but don't be surprised if it comes back with herpes.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk

text: “Everyone has secrets. It's just a matter of finding out what they are.”
author: Stieg Larsson,

text: “The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.”
author: Barack Obama

text: “Poetry is what gets lost in translation.”
author: Robert Frost

text: “I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.”
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz,

text: “How long was I asleep?" she whispered. He didn't respond.
author: Sarah J. Maas,

text: “Love: It will kill you and save you, both”
author: Lauren Oliver,

text: “There's no need to clarify my finger snap," said Magnus. "The implication was clear in the snap itself.”
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “Yes, we praise women over 40 for a multitude of reasons. Unfortunately, it's not reciprocal. For every stunning, smart, well-coiffed, hot woman over 40, there is a bald, paunchy relic in yellow pants making a fool of himself with some 22-year old waitress. Ladies, I apologize. For all those men who say, "Why buy the cow when you can get the milk for free?", here's an update for you. Nowadays 80% of women are against marriage. Why? Because women realize it's not worth buying an entire pig just to get a little sausage!”
author: Frank Kaiser

text: “Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.”
author: G.K. Chesterton

text: “أسوء تعذيب فى العالم هو الشخص المُصر على الكلام بينما أنت مُثقل بالهموم , ترغب فى أن تبقى صامتاً وأن تصغى لأفكارك.”
author: أحمد خالد توفيق

text: “Your emotions are the slaves to your thoughts, and you are the slave to your emotions.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

text: “Today is the sort of day where the sun only comes up to humiliate you.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk,

text: “The present changes the past. Looking back you do not find what you left behind.”
author: Kiran Desai,

text: “Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.”
author: anthony burgess

text: “Laugh, even when you feel too sick or too worn out or tired.
author: Alysha Speer

text: “One more time? For the audience?" he says. His voice isn't angry. It's hollow, which is worse. Already the boy with the bread is slipping away from me.
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “Man is the cruelest animal.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: “Lord, what fools these mortals be!”
author: William Shakespeare,

text: “God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of "parties" with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering.”
author: Sylvia Plath,

text: “I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it.”
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: “You don't love a girl because of beauty. You love her because she sings a song only you can understand.”
author: L.J. Smith,

text: “What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.”
author: Jack Kerouac,

text: “If my doctor told me I had only six minutes to live, I wouldn't brood. I'd type a little faster.”
author: Isaac Asimov

text: “It's like learning to ride a unicorn. You never forget.”
author: Eoin Colfer,

text: “In the end that was the choice you made, and it doesn't matter how hard it was to make it. It matters that you did.”
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “I am a part of all that I have met.”
author: Alfred Tennyson,

text: “After all, Ginger Rogers did everything that Fred Astaire did. She just did it backwards and in high heels.”
author: Ann Richards

text: “Books: a beautifully browsable invention that needs no electricity and exists in a readable form no matter what happens.”
author: Nicholson Baker

text: “Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.”
author: Marie Curie

text: “If you want to be happy, be.”
author: Tolstoy Leo

text: “there is a place in the heart that
author: Charles bukowski

text: “Here's to the kids.
author: Pete Wentz

text: “Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.”
author: Albert Einstein

text: “It matters not how strait the gate,
author: William Ernest Henley,

text: “Because this is what happens when you try to run from the past. It just doesn’t catch up, it overtakes … blotting out the future.”
author: Sarah Dessen,

text: “Ally." Peeta says the words slowly, tasting it. "Friend. Lover. Victor. Enemy. Fiancee. Target. Mutt. Neighbor. Hunter. Tribute. Ally. I'll add it to the list of words I use to try to figure you out. The problem is, I can't tell what's real anymore, and what's made up.”
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “That's what fiction is for. It's for getting at the truth when the truth isn't sufficient for the truth.”
author: Tim O'Brien

text: “You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.”
author: Anaïs Nin,

text: “She was ready to deny the existence of space and time rather than admit that love might not be eternal.”
author: Simone de Beauvoir,

text: “You think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “Katniss, the girl who was on fire!”
author: Suzanne Collins,

text: “Threats are the last resort of a man with no vocabulary.”
author: Tamora Pierce,

text: “I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: "Go down again - I dwell among the people.”
author: John Henry Newman

text: “I was always hungry for love. Just once, I wanted to know what it was like to get my fill of it -- to be fed so much love I couldn't take any more. Just once. ”
author: Haruki Murakami,

text: “I walk around the school hallways and look at the people. I look at the teachers and wonder why they're here. If they like their jobs. Or us. And I wonder how smart they were when they were fifteen. Not in a mean way. In a curious way. It's like looking at all the students and wondering who's had their heart broken that day, and how they are able to cope with having three quizzes and a book report due on top of that. Or wondering who did the heart breaking. And wondering why.”
author: Stephen Chbosky,

text: “We are all born mad. Some remain so.”
author: Samuel Beckett

text: “Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: “It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.”
author: George Washington

text: “what's your name?"
author: Richelle Mead,

text: “Whatever you do, you need courage. Whatever course you decide upon, there is always someone to tell you that you are wrong. There are always difficulties arising that tempt you to believe your critics are right. To map out a course of action and follow it to an end requires some of the same courage that a soldier needs. Peace has its victories, but it takes brave men and women to win them.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: “في داخلي شُرْفَةٌ
author: محمود درويش

text: “I suspect the most we can hope for, and it's no small hope, is that we never give up, that we never stop giving ourselves permission to try to love and receive love.”
author: Elizabeth Strout,

text: “The sad truth is the truth is sad.”
author: Lemony Snicket,

text: “Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.”
author: Oliver Goldsmith,

text: “I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way.”
author: Carl Sandburg

text: “It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.”
author: George Orwell,

text: “Stepping onto a brand-new path is difficult, but not more difficult than remaining in a situation, which is not nurturing to the whole woman.”
author: Maya Angelou

text: “There were always in me, two women at least, one woman desperate and bewildered, who felt she was drowning and another who would leap into a scene, as upon a stage, conceal her true emotions because they were weaknesses, helplessness, despair, and present to the world only a smile, an eagerness, curiosity, enthusiasm, interest.”
author: Anais Nin

text: “. . . when it comes down to it, that’s what life is all about: showing up for the people you love, again and again, until you can’t show up anymore.”
author: Rebecca Walker,

text: “There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.”
author: Arthur Conan Doyle,

text: “The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.”
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: “Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.”
author: Albert Camus,

text: “You can't lie to your soul.”
author: Irvine Welsh,

text: “Not that I want to be a god or a hero. Just to change into a tree, grow for ages, not hurt anyone.”
author: Czeslaw Milosz

text: “I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.”
author: Stephen Chbosky,

text: “Where is Wood?" said Harry, suddenly realizing he wasn't there.
author: J. K. Rowling,

text: “Book collecting is an obsession, an occupation, a disease, an addiction, a fascination, an absurdity, a fate. It is not a hobby. Those who do it must do it. Those who do not do it, think of it as a cousin of stamp collecting, a sister of the trophy cabinet, bastard of a sound bank account and a weak mind.”
author: Jeanette Winterson

text: “You're beautiful and sad," I said finally, not looking at him when I did. "Just like your eyes. You're like a song that I heard when I was a little kid but forgot I knew until I heard it again." For a long moment there was only the whirring sound of the tires on the road, and then Sam said softly, "Thank you.”
author: Maggie Stiefvater,

text: “I'm not lost for I know where I am. But however, where I am may be lost.”
author: A.A. Milne,

text: “There were things I wanted to tell him. But I knew they would hurt him. So I buried them, and let them hurt me.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

text: “I sit beside the fire and think
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: “Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.”
author: Roy T. Bennett,

text: “Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.”
author: Albert Camus

text: “If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.”
author: Mother Teresa

text: “This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.”
author: Paulo Coelho,

text: “Demons run when a good man goes to war
author: Steven Moffat

text: “livid,
author: David Levithan,

text: “No matter how plain a woman may be, if truth and honesty are written across her face, she will be beautiful.”
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: “It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.”
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,

text: “Here's what's not beautiful about it: from here, you can't see the rust or the cracked paint or whatever, but you can tell what the place really is. You can see how fake it all is. It's not even hard enough to be made out of plastic. It's a paper town. I mean, look at it, Q: look at all those culs-de-sac, those streets that turn in on themselves, all the houses that were built to fall apart. All those paper people living in their paper houses, burning the future to stay warm. All the paper kids drinking beer some bum bought for them at the paper convenience store. Everyone demented with the mania of owning things. All the things paper-thin and paper-frail. And all the people, too. I've lived here for eighteen years and I have never once in my life come across anyone who cares about anything that matters.”
author: John Green,

text: “In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity”
author: Albert Einstein

text: “A question that sometimes drives me hazy: am I or are the others crazy?”
author: Albert Einstein

text: “He stepped back and threw his arms out.
author: Richelle Mead,

text: “If you try to fail, and succeed, which have you done?”
author: George Carlin

text: “The Voice
author: Shel Silverstein

text: “Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.”
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: “I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.”
author: Albert Camus,

text: “Just tell me how to be different in a way that makes sense.”
author: Stephen Chbosky,

text: “I would have come for you. And if I couldn't walk, I'd crawl to you, and no matter how broken we were, we'd fight our way out together-knives drawn, pistols blazing. Because that's what we do. We never stop fighting.”
author: Leigh Bardugo,

text: “You can go through life and make new friends every year - every month practically - but there was never any substitute for those friendships of childhood that survive into adult years. Those are the ones in which we are bound to one another with hoops of steel.”
author: Alexander McCall Smith,

text: “None of us knows what might happen even the next minute, yet still we go forward. Because we trust. Because we have Faith.”
author: Paulo Coelho,

text: “I used to believe in forever, but forever's too good to be true”
author: A.A. Milne,

text: “The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.”
author: Rick Riordan,

text: “Sometimes I lie awake at night, and I ask, 'Where have I gone wrong'.
author: Charlie Schultz

text: “Please believe that one single positive dream is more important than a thousand negative realities.”
author: Adeline Yen Mah,

text: “She wanted something to happen - something, anything: she did not know what.”
author: Kate Chopin

text: “There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kills.”
author: Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

text: “You can’t tell me
author: Jamie McGuire,

text: “I just did some calculations and I've been able to determine that you're full of shit.”
author: John Green,

text: “Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.”
author: Marcus Aurelius ,

text: “In new situations, all the trickiest rules are the ones nobody bothers to explain to you. (And the ones you can't Google.)”
author: Rainbow Rowell,

text: “The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.”
author: Katie McGarry,

text: “The bond forged between us was not one that could be broken by absence, distance, or time. And no matter how much more special or beautiful or brilliant or perfect than me he might be, he was as irreversibly altered as I was. As I would always belong to him, so would he always be mine.”
author: Stephenie Meyer,

text: “If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.”
author: Lewis Caroll,

text: “Like all magnificent things, it's very simple.”
author: Natalie Babbitt,

text: “It is the absence of facts that frightens people: the gap you open, into which they pour their fears, fantasies, desires.”
author: Hilary Mantel,

text: “The past beats inside me like a second heart.”
author: John Banville,

text: “If you ever meet the man who could take advantage of Isabelle, you’ll have to let me know. I’d like to shake his hand. Or run away from him very fast, I’m not sure which.”
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!”
author: Adolf Hitler

text: “Half the world is composed of people who have something to say and can't, and the other half who have nothing to say and keep on saying it.”
author: Robert Frost

text: “Your thorns are the best part of you.”
author: Marianne Moore

text: “Love is . . . Being happy for the other person when they are happy, Being sad for the person when they are sad, Being together in good times, And being together in bad times.
author: Susan Polis Schutz

text: “Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.”
author: Oscar Wilde,

text: “There is nobility in the struggle, you don't have to win.”
author: Sharon Pollock

text: “A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.”
author: Gilles Deleuze,

text: “I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him.”
author: Galileo Galilei

text: “From now on, I don't care if my tea leaves spell 'Die, Ron, Die,' I'm chucking them in the bin where they belong.”
author: J.K. Rowling,

text: “What a kid I got, I told him about the birds and the bees and he told me about the butcher and my wife.”
author: Rodney Dangerfield

text: “To me, “FEARLESS” is not the absence of fear. It’s not being completely unafraid. To me, FEARLESS is having fears. FEARLESS is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, FEARLESS is living in spite of those things that scare you to death. FEARLESS is falling madly in love again, even though you’ve been hurt before. FEARLESS is walking into your freshmen year of high school at fifteen. FEARLESS is getting back up and fighting for what you want over and over again… even though every time you’ve tried before, you’ve lost. It’s FEARLESS to have faith that someday things will change. FEARLESS is having the courage to say goodbye to someone who only hurts you, even if you can’t breathe without them. I think it’s FEARLESS to fall for your best friend, even though he’s in love with someone else. And when someone apologizes to you enough times for things they’ll never stop doing, I think it’s FEARLESS to stop believing them. It’s FEARLESS to say “you’re NOT sorry”, and walk away. I think loving someone despite what people think is FEARLESS. I think allowing yourself to cry on the bathroom floor is FEARLESS. Letting go is FEARLESS. Then, moving on and being alright…That’sFEARLESS too. But no matter what love throws at you, you have to believe in it. You have to believe in love stories and prince charmings and happily ever after. That’s why I write these songs. Because I think love is FEARLESS.”
author: Taylor Swift

text: “The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.”
author: George Carlin

text: “I won't ever leave you, even though you're always leaving me.”
author: Audrey Niffenegger,

text: “My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them.”
author: Jack Kerouac

text: “It is difficult, when faced with a situation you cannot control, to admit you can do nothing.”
author: Lemony Snicket,

text: “The Bhagavad Gita--that ancient Indian Yogic text--says that it is better to live your own destiny imperfectly than to live an imitation of somebody else's life with perfection.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

text: “sometimes you don't need a goal in life, you don't need to know the big picture. you just need to know what you're going to do next!”
author: Sophie Kinsella,

text: “Only someone who is well prepared has the opportunity to improvise.”
author: Ingmar Bergman

text: “And O there are days in this life, worth life and worth death.”
author: Charles Dickens,

text: “It is always sad when someone leaves home, unless they are simply going around the corner and will return in a few minutes with ice-cream sandwiches.”
author: Lemony Snicket,

text: “Dreams are the touchstones of our characters.”
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: “Listen to them, the children of the night. What music they make!”
author: Bram Stoker

text: “What can you do to promote world peace? Go home and love your family.”
author: Mother Teresa

text: “لا تقدم ابداً شروحاً لأحد.. أصدقاؤك الحقيقيون ليسوا فى حاجة إليها و أعداؤك لن يصدقوها”
author: أحلام مستغانمي,

text: “Never be afraid to sit awhile and think.”
author: Lorraine Hansberry

text: “So you're a Shadowhunter,' Nate said. 'De Quincey told me that you lot were monsters.'
author: Cassandra Clare,

text: “Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home.”
author: Edith Sitwell

text: “The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.”
author: Sun Tzu,

text: “Adventure is worthwhile in itself.”
author: Amelia Earhart

text: “If a man will begin with certainties, he shall end in doubts; but if he will be content to begin with doubts, he shall end in certainties.”
author: Francis Bacon,

text: “I'll try anything once, twice if I like it, three times to make sure.”
author: Mae West

text: “Everything in the world exists in order to end up as a book.”
author: Stéphane Mallarmé

text: “The most beautiful makeup of a woman is passion. But cosmetics are easier to buy.”
author: Yves Saint Laurent

text: “I found myself thinking about President William McKinley, the third American president to be assassinated. He lived for several days after he was shot, and towards the end, his wife started crying and screaming, "I want to go too! I want to go too!" And with his last measure of strength, McKinley turned to her and spoke his last words: "We are all going.”
author: John Green,

text: “You cannot pick and choose what parts of her to love.”
author: Sarah J. Maas,

text: “Every couple needs to argue now and then. Just to prove that the relationship is strong enough to survive. Long-term relationships, the ones that matter, are all about weathering the peaks and the valleys.”
author: Nicholas Sparks,

text: “I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day, and I believe in miracles”
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: “That was one of the virtues of being a pessimist: nothing was ever as bad as you thought it would be.”
author: James Jones,

text: “It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.”
author: Victor Hugo,

text: “Ordinary life is pretty complex stuff.”
author: Harvey Pekar

text: “In order to be irreplaceacle, one must always be different.”
author: Coco Chanel

text: “All human wisdom is contained in these two words - Wait and Hope”
author: Alexandre Dumas,

text: “Child, child, do you not see? For each of us comes a time when we must be more than what we are.”
author: Lloyd Alexander,

text: “Even when you have doubts, take that step. Take chances. Mistakes are never a failure—they can be turned into wisdom.”
author: Cat Cora

text: “In secret we met
author: George Gordon Byron

text: “I’m glad we had the times together just to laugh and sing a song, seems like we just got started and then before you know it, the times we had together were gone.”
author: Dr. Seuss

text: “He cleared his throat and held up one hand dramatically.
author: Rick Riordan,

text: “The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true.”
author: James Branch Cabell,

text: “Parents are like God because you wanna know they're out there, and you want them to think well of you, but you really only call when you need something.”
author: Chuck Palahniuk,

text: “It’s only after you’ve stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.”
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: “And hand in hand, on the edge of the sand,
author: Edward Lear,

text: “The only calibration that counts is how much heart people invest, how much they ignore their fears of being hurt or caught out or humiliated. And the only thing people regret is that they didn't live boldly enough, that they didn't invest enough heart, didn't love enough. Nothing else really counts at all.”
author: Ted Hughes,

text: “I feel too much. That's what's going on.' 'Do you think one can feel too much? Or just feel in the wrong ways?' 'My insides don't match up with my outsides.' 'Do anyone's insides and outsides match up?' 'I don't know. I'm only me.' 'Maybe that's what a person's personality is: the difference between the inside and outside.' 'But it's worse for me.' 'I wonder if everyone thinks it's worse for him.' 'Probably. But it really is worse for me.”
author: Jonathan Safran Foer,

text: “I know all those words, but that sentence makes no sense to me.”
author: Matt Groening

text: “Stay is a charming word in a friend's vocabulary.”
author: Amos Bronson Alcott,

text: “I always worried someone would notice me, and then when no one did, I felt lonely.”
author: Curtis Sittenfeld,

text: “No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.”
author: Aristotle

text: “Romance is the glamour which turns the dust of everyday life into a golden haze. ”
author: Elinor Glyn

text: “Our imagination flies -- we are its shadow on the earth.”
author: Vladimir Nabokov

text: “Books fall open, you fall in.”
author: David T.W. McCord

text: “It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.”
author: John Steinbeck,

text: “I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.”
author: Stephanie Perkins,

text: “Marriage can wait, education cannot.”
author: Khaled Hosseini,
